intro: Stenosolen eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in coastal regions. Stenosolen eggersii is adapted to withstand arid conditions and is often seen in shrublands and coastal heath.
